item.title: Pokemon GO Leveling Update Just Highlighted a Big Problem with the Game
item.description:
Pokemon GO just released its new leveling update, which raised the level cap from 50 to 80 and gave players who were under that new threshold a boost. Part of that boost was a smoothing of the leveling process to ensure that players find the ramps between levels a little easier to climb. And a byproduct of that smoothing was that players who were under level 50 instantly saw their level jump up dramatically. For example, I was level 35 in Pokemon GO before the update, and post-update, I jumped up to level 43.

You would think that this would be a good thing across the board – a better leveling process and a boost to current players. And, truthfully, there are so many positives about the Pokemon GO leveling update , from the increases to storage to the daily adventure egg, but this initial rollout of the update highlighted a major problem the game still has to this day.

In Pokemon GO, More Items Can Mean More Problems

Any time that a player levels up in Pokemon GO , they earn a number of rewards, from cosmetics to Pokeballs, to berries to restorative items. It’s a bounty that, depending on your storage space, can be overwhelming or rejuvenating.

If you are teetering on the edge of full item storage space, the items are usually swiftly deleted or less valuable ones are sacrificed in their place. If you are hurting for Master Balls or Max Revives, the level up rewards are a welcome boost to your inventory. Now imagine gaining two levels at once. Now imagine three. Now imagine, in mine and many other players’ cases, gaining 8 levels at once!

Why Can't I Spin Pokestops With Full Item Storage?

At first glance, gaining all of these items should be a huge boon, regardless of if you are a hardcore or casual Pokemon GO player. But the problem is that the game limits one of its most important features when your storage is full. You can’t spin Pokestops with full item storage, and spinning Pokestops is important for several reasons:

  • You can’t earn special research without spinning Pokestops
  • You can’t earn your daily bonus without spinning Pokestops
  • You can’t earn gifts without spinning Pokestops
  • You can’t earn progress on tasks that require spinning Pokestops

Shortly after the leveling update went live, social media, forums, and subreddits were swarmed with Pokemon GO players showing their storage woes. For me, the storage overage was in the 200 range, but for other players it was in the thousands.

I can only imagine having to go through and delete hundreds of items in various categories, just to make space for the same types of items you get from Pokestops. That’s the real issue: you usually aren’t deleting items to make way for better items, you are just deleting items to open up space to get similar or lesser items (e.g., deleting Master Balls to then get Pokeballs from Pokestops).

Now, this has been an issue for quite some time, but usually it’s more of an inconvenience than it is a roadblock. You spin a Pokestop and see that your item storage is full, delete a few items , and then spin again. But when you need to delete thousands of items, that’s less of an easy fix and is extremely frustrating.

If players could simply spin Pokestops even when their item storage is full, then this wouldn’t be an issue. In fact, there is already a precedent for this type of feature in the game. If you toggle on a setting, you can still open gifts even when your item storage is full in order to level up your bond with a friend and earn Stardust. Niantic even at one point had the option to spin Pokestops with full item storage , but apparently it was too buggy and they removed the feature .

In the grand scheme of player requests, this might be low on the totem pole, but I do think it’s an issue worth addressing in the future. The loop of catching Pokemon and spinning Pokestops is at the core of Pokemon GO , and this limitation fights against it. Storage is always going to be something that Pokemon players have to deal with, and the solution of using Pokecoins to buy more storage plays into Niantic’s bottom line , which makes sense for a free-to-play game.

The October season pass offers Pokecoins on its free and premium tracks, so you should be able to buy some storage upgrades this month.

By and large, the Pokemon GO leveling update is a good thing, even if this one detail led to a lot of frustration among the more dedicated players. More levels to chase, rewards to unlock, and the new features are all welcome additions to a game that is still going strong nearly 10 years later. But please, Niantic, make it so Pokemon GO players can spin Pokestops with full item storage.

Pokemon GO is available now for iOS and Android.

103
8.4 /10

Pokémon GO

item.title: Best Triple-A Games With Co-Op
item.description:
Many modern triple-A games let players enjoy them with others, whether it’s friends, family, or random people joining online. For fans of social play, there’s plenty of choice, with some games built entirely around co-op, while others offer their full story campaigns in co-op or include extensive additional modes for shared play.

The demand for high-quality co-op action-adventure games is at an all-time high, with many recent titles offering these options becoming some of the most popular games across various platforms. Below are must-play AAA games for players looking to have a great time in co-op with friends in 2025.

Even though the development teams of some of the games listed below may not be huge, their production values and significant budgets are AAA level.

Split Fiction

You Should Make A Friend For This

Split Fiction
19
8.8 /10
Released
March 6, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Blood and Gore, Crude Humor, Language, Violence
Powered by

The latest Hazelight creation, Split Fiction , is an indisputable must-play of 2025 for anyone who enjoys unforgettable co-operative adventures. Exclusively built around two players, Split Fiction can’t be played solo, but it’s easy to get a second player for the story campaign thanks to the game’s Friend Pass feature, which doesn’t require owning two copies to play.

As one of the most prominent modern studios building games exclusively for co-op, other Hazelight titles are also a natural destination for any co-op fan, especially It Takes Two , which snagged the GOTY award back in 2021. It remains to be seen how Split Fiction ’s end-of-year awards will compare to the studio’s previous work.

Helldivers 2

Super Earth Needs You

Helldivers 2
9 /10
61
8.8 /10
Released
February 8, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ / Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, In-Game Purchases, Users Interact
Powered by

The long-awaited PlayStation success among live-service titles, Helldivers 2 has exceeded expectations, becoming a true smash hit on both consoles and PC, with a thriving community, constant updates, and an exceptional approach to the model. Helldivers 2 feels like an ever-evolving world, where each new addition brings substantial changes while following the established rules of its universe.

Helldivers 2 doesn’t offer a traditional single-player campaign. Instead, players can enjoy cooperative PvE multiplayer with up to four participants, including cross-play options. With its chaotic yet cinematic gameplay, Helldivers 2 delivers awe-inspiring moments best shared with friends. While some players believe the game needs extra modes such as PvP, no such plans have been announced so far.

Borderlands 4

Probably The Best In The Co-Op-Driven Series

Borderlands 4
8 /10
30
8.2 /10
Released
September 12, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ / Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, In-Game Purchases, Users Interact
Powered by

One of the newest additions to the AAA co-op family, Borderlands 4 was designed for co-op despite being playable solo, including local splitscreen options for two players. The series has always been known for its cooperative PvE multiplayer, allowing the entire campaign to be played with up to four players, and Borderlands 4 stays true to its core. What’s more, it’s easily among the best and most fun games in the looter-shooter franchise.

With its easy-to-set-up drop-in/drop-out action and generous options for how players can join, including two local splitscreen modes combined for a total party of four, it’s a flexible modern action-shooter packed with content players can enjoy for dozens of hours.

Baldur’s Gate 3

We Don’t Get RPGs Like This Too Often

Baldur's Gate 3
9 /10
145
9.7 /10
Released
August 3, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Baldur’s Gate 3 offers a rare feat for such an expansive RPG, letting players experience its entire epic campaign either solo or in online co-op. It’s safe to assume the game’s colossal success was partly due to this, given how many chose to enjoy the sprawling adventure alongside partners or friends.

Baldur’s Gate 3 supports two to four players in the campaign, even allowing a full party of customized characters to explore. There’s also a local splitscreen option for two players, which was challenging for the developers to bring to the Xbox Series S.

Sea Of Thieves

Yo-Ho-Ho, And A Bottle Of Rum

Sea of Thieves
7.7 /10
Released
March 20, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Crude Humor, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Powered by

A perfect example of how a mediocre launch can eventually lead to something far greater, Sea of Thieves is now a thriving online destination for any co-op fan and an ultimate pirate adventure packed with fun. While it’s possible to play solo, Sea of Thieves is designed for online multiplayer in a shared world, where up to four players work together as a pirate crew.

Over the years, Sea of Thieves has become one of the most recognizable live-service games for co-op and a real gem in the Game Pass roster. Suitable for both hardcore adventurers and casual players looking to team up, this game won’t disappoint.

Destiny 2

Like A Second Life

Destiny 2
53
7.7 /10
Released
August 28, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For TEEN for Blood, Language, and Violence
Powered by

Destiny 2 needs little introduction, serving as a prime example of the live-service model built around co-operative play. With its abundance of modes, including PvE story campaigns, PvP competition, and even hybrids of the two, Destiny 2 is a game where players can literally spend years.

That scale has also become a double-edged sword, as the sheer amount of content is hard to maintain, prompting the developers to lock certain parts of the game, which can make entry challenging for newcomers. Nevertheless, there’s always something new in Destiny 2 , and despite controversies and complications, it remains the ultimate destination for sprawling space shooter fans, with few real alternatives at its scale.

Diablo 4

Standing Tall Amid ARPG Competitors

Diablo 4
9 /10
114
7.5 /10
Released
June 5, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ / Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language, In-Game Purchases, Users Interact
Powered by

The latest entry in the legendary action-RPG series, Diablo 4 may not meet every fan’s expectations, but it remains a colossal dark fantasy adventure with robust co-op options. Perfectly playable solo, Diablo 4 also offers a vast shared world and supports parties of up to four players exploring Sanctuary together.

The game includes two-player local co-op, though it’s a step back from Diablo 3 ’s four-player local multiplayer. There’s also a PvP mode for those looking to test their skills against other warriors. Overall, Diablo 4 is an impressive package, and few modern ARPGs can match the sheer fun of its shared play.

The Division 2

Best For Fans Of Grounded Settings And Tactical Combat

Tom Clancy's The Division 2
15
8.5 /10
Released
March 15, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Drug Reference, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

After years of evolution, Tom Clancy’s The Division 2 remains a standout example of a modern triple-A open-world game with a strong co-op focus. Most of the game can be played solo, but it’s clear that player interaction is central, with co-op truly shining and offering challenging missions not easily completed alone.

Its unique structure blends PvE and PvP zones into one seamless world, while an abundance of additional modes for up to four players provides an endless stream of endgame activities for even the most seasoned agents. Despite its seven-year lifespan, The Division 2 is easy to pick up and enjoy, with flexible difficulty settings and an engaging, cinematic narrative.

Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2

Old-School Approach Bears Fruit

Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine II
9 /10
34
9.1 /10
Released
September 9, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence
Powered by

A rare example of an old-fashioned approach to co-op in the modern gaming landscape, Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 became a huge hit thanks to its uncompromising dedication to the beloved universe, visceral combat, and striking visuals. Unlike many other co-op games, Space Marine 2 limits the party to three players. The story campaign is fully playable in co-op and is the definitive way to experience the game.

The real fun begins afterward, as players tackle complex endgame missions and activities added post-launch or test their skills in PvP with an ever-growing arsenal of weapons and cosmetics. Recently, Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 received its first anniversary update, bringing a second Season Pass and an exciting road ahead for fans, including two brand-new game modes.

Monster Hunter Wilds

A Bit Of A Bumpy Ride With The Promise Of Greatness

Monster Hunter Wilds
58
8.2 /10
Released
February 28, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Violence, Blood, Crude Humor
Powered by

Though marred by technical hiccups, especially rough on mid-range PCs, that the developers continue to patch, Monster Hunter Wilds is hard to ignore for any co-op fan in 2025 and will only get better in the coming months. A massive four-player co-op title with robust combat, a stunning world, and dynamic monster behavior, it’s one of the year’s standout releases, taking the series to new heights.

Monster Hunter Wilds shines with its core gameplay loop of large-scale hunts and player interactions, even making the grind satisfying. It’s also more accessible than ever, with subtle improvements and cross-play features. While still a bumpy ride for some, there’s hope the remaining issues will be resolved, allowing it to fully join the ranks of the best AAA co-op games.

item.title: Grand Theft Auto 6 Can’t Repeat the Same Mistake Rockstar Made With GTA 5
item.description:
Grand Theft Auto 6 is already poised to be the biggest video game launch of this generation, and potentially of all time. The shadow of the sixth mainline entry in the popular open world crime franchise loomed so large that some publishers were unwilling to reveal dates for their games to avoid releasing too close to Rockstar Games’ juggernaut. But while Grand Theft Auto 6 is a certified slam dunk based on the absurd popularity of GTA 5 , there is one element from Grand Theft Auto 5 ’s long development timeline that Rockstar Games should approach differently this time around.

DLC had been a key part of Rockstar Games’ post-release plans for many of its major releases . Lost and the Damned , Ballad of Gay Tony , and Undead Nightmare are singular experiences that existed within the world of their respective games, but told stories that were unique and didn’t need to support a 50+ hour open world experience. With those add-ons in mind, fans were eager to see what Rockstar would do with Grand Theft Auto 5 ’s DLC, but unfortunately, no single-player expansions were ever released.

There were rumors that Grand Theft Auto 5 had single player DLC in the works at various points in its post-launch development, but they were eventually scrapped in favor of focusing on GTA Online . It’s easy to see why Rockstar favored the cash cow that is Grand Theft Auto Online – even now, the mode continues to receive regular support – but it was disappointing that single player fans never got the opportunity to jump back into Los Santos.

For Grand Theft Auto 6 , Rockstar Games should tap back into that DLC pipeline. With the added development time between GTA 5 and now, the hope is that the studio can find a way to balance GTA Online and single player offerings so single player and multiplayer fans can have something to enjoy. There’s no scenario where GTA Online goes away so the only option is to balance both. Of course, if the studio has to choose between online and single player DLC, there’s little doubt which aspect would be sacrificed, but that would be a mistake.

Rockstar shouldn't prioritize GTA Online over single-player offerings in GTA 6!

Rockstar Games’ team are masterful storytellers, capable of weaving intricate tales that impress, delight, and move. While most point to Grand Theft Auto 5 for its open world action, the story beats of Red Dead Redemption 2 are what are regularly discussed when it comes to the narrative strengths of the studio. Presuming that GTA 6 will put a premium on gameplay in the main campaign – although the dual protagonist approach with one female and one male main character is intriguing – then single player DLC offers the opportunity to stretch those storytelling muscles.

It's true that Grand Theft Auto 6 doesn’t need to offer any one thing for the game to be successful. In fact, there’s a strong possibility that this will be the biggest entertainment launch regardless of pre-release reviews, perception of trailers, or controversies. Even rumors that the game might be $100 likely won’t deter a lot of people from picking up the title, because the value proposition inherent to Grand Theft Auto’s open world is a lot more justifiable than a lot of other premium-priced games.

Still, for Grand Theft Auto 6 to be impactful to the fans of the series that have been around since the early days (or maybe just when Grand Theft Auto 3 flipped the formula), hopefully, Rockstar Games doesn’t repeat the mistake of GTA 5 and skip single player DLC.

Grand Theft Auto releases May 26, 2026 for PS5 and Xbox Series X/S.

Grand Theft Auto 6

Grand Theft Auto VI heads to the state of Leonida, home to the neon-soaked streets of Vice City and beyond in the biggest, most immersive evolution of the Grand Theft Auto series yet.

Jason and Lucia have always known the deck is stacked against them. But when an easy score goes wrong, they find themselves on the darkest side of the sunniest place in America, in the middle of a criminal conspiracy stretching across the state of Leonida — forced to rely on each other more than ever if they want to make it out alive.

item.title: Battlefield 6: All Weapon Stats, Explained
item.description:
Every gun in Battlefield 6 has a number of different stats associated with them, and unfortunately, the game doesn't clarify what most of them do. Some, like reload speed, are self-explanatory, but Mobility and Precision can mean a lot of different things. These stats are all important, especially when you're building your guns in BF6 , so you'll want to know what each of them does.

All Weapon Stats in Battlefield 6

There are nine different stats shown on the info screens for every gun in Battlefield 6 , and while four of them are fully featured with arbitrary numbers and meters, the rest are indicated by smaller numbers found in the bottom-right corner of your screen. These in-game weapon stats include:

Battlefield 6 Weapon Stats

Hipfire

Affects your weapon's accuracy when you are not aiming down sights. A higher Hipfire stat tightens your initial shot grouping and reduces bloom while hipfiring.

Precision

Affects your weapon bloom in BF6 while aiming down sights. Higher Precision reduces the effects of bloom, making your gun more accurate while firing long bursts.

Control

Control measures the intensity of your gun's recoil. Weapons with a high Control stat shake less violently when firing, though recoil pattern remains unaffected.

Mobility

Mobility reflects your movement speed and accuracy while aiming. This also reflects your speed when you are shooting while aiming down sights.

Fire Mode

Lets you toggle between Semi, Burst, and Full Auto firing modes, depending on which ones are available to your chosen gun.

ADS Time In

Refers to how quickly you raise your weapon to aim down sights. This value is measured in milliseconds.

Reload Speed

Determines how quickly you can reload your weapon — measured in seconds.

Muzzle Velocity

The speed at which the bullets from your weapon fly toward your target — measured in meters per second.

Headshot Multiplier

Multiplies your weapon's damage by a set amount when you score a headshot. Most weapons have a x1.34 multiplier, while DMRs and sniper rifles have x1.50 and x1.75 respectively.

The majority of these stats are affected by different attachments . If you want a gun that makes you more accurate while moving, then prioritize using attachments that improve your Precision and Mobility stats. Different attachment categories affect different stats:

  • Muzzle devices primarily affect Control, reducing the recoil you feel in Battlefield 6 .
  • Underbarrel grips also mainly affect Control, but some options also affect Mobility and Precision by making you more or less accurate when firing or moving.
  • Magazines affect your ammo count and reload speed, but often at the cost of Mobility.
  • Laser accessories drastically improve your Hipfire, but they make you easier to spot.
  • Ergonomics attachments improve Reload Speed and Control, but not all weapons have access to the same options.
  • Ammo types affect either Control, Mobility or Headshot Multiplier.
Battlefield 6

item.title: How to Get Fossil Pokemon in Pokemon Legends Z-A
item.description:
Fossil Pokemon are back in Pokemon Legends Z-A , and players are excited about picking one of the three available (for now) prehistoric species to resurrect and train. But unlocking the equipment required to revive Fossils doesn't happen straight away, so players need to fulfill certain requirements, as well as find where to get the actual genetic material to bring back to life some ancient creatures in Lumiose City.

In this step-by-step guide, players will learn where to restore Fossils and how to get the materials needed for this process. It also has information on which Pokemon are available for resurrection and whether they can be shiny or not, as well as how to unlock this feature in Pokemon Legends Z-A .

How to Restore Fossil Pokemon in Legends Z-A

The process to get Fossil Pokemon in Pokemon Legends Z-A is similar to that of previous generation games, where players need to bring genetic materials from fossils to the laboratory and resurrect the Pokemon using a machine. The place where this happens is the Pokemon Research Lab located near Wild Area 1, in South Lumiose. Players will naturally unlock this place during the introductory Mission, so now, the question is: How to unlock Fossil Restoration?

How to Unlock Fossil Restoration in Pokemon Legends Z-A

To unlock the Fossil Restoration gimmick in Pokemon Legends Z-A , players need to first complete up to the Main Story Mission 10 - The Secrets of Mega Evolution, and once they complete it and become F Rank, they will be able to check the Map and see that a Secondary Mission Icon has appeared over the Laboratory .

This corresponds to the Secondary Mission called " Restored from a Fossil ," and to start it, players need to go to the 2nd Floor of the Laboratory and talk to the new NPC that has appeared next to the Machine in the middle of the room. The NPC will give players 20000 Poke Dollars to go and purchase one of the two Fossils available in Stone Emporium (it also sells Ancient Amber, but we will go back to this later).

Now head to Stone Emporium, located on Vernal Avenue, which is north of the Laboratory. Travel there and purchase either the Sail Fossil ( Amaura ) or the Jaw Fossil ( Tyrunt ), as each of these costs 20000. Once players have picked the first Fossil Pokemon they want to resurrect, they should go back to the Lab and give the Fossil to the Researcher. After a brief dialogue, he will proceed with the regeneration process, and as a result, Tyrunt or Amaura will be reborn.

All Available Fossils in Pokemon Legends Z-A & Can They Be Shiny?

Now that the Fossil Regeneration Machine is unlocked, players can go ahead and resurrect as many Fossils as they want. The six available Fossil Pokemon in the game are Aerodactyl , Mega Aerodactyl , Tyrunt , Tyrantrum , Amaura , and Aurorus .

Amaura

Aurorus

Aerodactyl

Tyrunt

Tyrantrum

  • Amaura evolves into Aurorus at Level 39, during the Night .
  • Tyrunt evolves into Tyrantrum at Level 39 , during the Day.
  • Aerodactyl evolves into Mega Aerodactyl while holding the Aerodactylite.

All of these Pokemon are available in their Shiny versions , though getting one could be considered one of the most challenging feats in the game. Some might be thinking about farming money and purchasing tons of Fossils to aim for that Shiny Tyrunt, Amaura, or Aerodactyl, but before they spend hundreds of Poke Dollars, the truth is there's a simpler method: by saving the game, restoring the Fossil, and restarting.

The Shiny Charm effect doesn't affect Fossil Pokemon, so the odds remain unaltered despite having this Key Item. Players will have to rely on RNG/Trial and Error, since Fossils have 1 in 4060 chances of being Shiny.
